00071 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00072 
00073 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00074 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00075 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00076 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00077 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00078 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00079 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00080 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00081 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00082 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00084 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00085 
00086 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00087 
00088 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00089 
00090 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00100 
00101 {
00102     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00103     spl_t flags;
00104 
00105     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00106 
00107     adeos_load_cpuid();
00108 
00109     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00110         {
00111         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00112             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00113         }
00114     else
00115         flags |= 2;
00116 
00117     return flags;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00121 
00122 {
00123     if (!(flags & 2))
00124         {
00125         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00126 
00127         rthal_cli();
00128 
00129         adeos_load_cpuid();
00130 
00131         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00132             {
00133             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00134             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00135             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00136             }
00137         }
00138 
00139     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00140 }
00141 
00142 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00143 
00144 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00145 
00146 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00147 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00148 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00149 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00150 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00151 
00152 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00154 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00155 
00156 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00157 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00158 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00159 /* Using 2/3 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00160    experimentation that proved to fit on tested PPC platforms with
00161    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00162    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00163    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00164 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 2 / 3)

00204 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00205 
00206     /* Kernel mode side */
00207 
00208 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00209     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00210        and SPE are not available to kernel-based Xenomai threads. */
00211     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00212     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00213 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00214 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00215 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00216 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00217 
00218     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00219     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00220     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00221     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00222 
00223     /* User mode side */
00224     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00225     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00226 
00227     /* Init block */
00228     struct xnthread *self;
00229     int imask;
00230     const char *name;
00231     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00232     void *cookie;
00233 
00234 } xnarchtcb_t;

00250 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00251     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00252 }
00253 
00254 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00255     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00256 }
00257 
00258 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00259     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00260 }
00261 
00262 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00263     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00264 }

00266 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00267     return adeos_processor_id();
00268 }

00274 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00275 do { \
00276     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00277     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00278     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00279     for (;;) ;                          \
00280 } while(0)

00285 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00286 
00287 {
00288     spl_t s;
00289     splhigh(s);
00290     splexit(!!imask);
00291     return !!s;
00292 }

00296 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00297                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00298                                                    void *cookie),
00299                                    void *cookie)
00300 {
00301     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00302 
00303     if (!err)
00304         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00305 
00306     return err;
00307 }
00308 
00309 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00310 
00311     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00315 
00316 {
00317     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00318         return -EINVAL;
00319 
00320     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00321 
00322     return 0;
00323 }
00324 
00325 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00326 
00327 {
00328     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00329         return -EINVAL;
00330 
00331     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00332 
00333     return 0;
00334 }
00335

00337     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00338 }
00339 
00340 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00341     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00342 }

00344 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00345 
00346     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00347 }

00361 
00362 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00363 
00364 {
00365 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00366     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00367 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00368     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00369        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00370     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00371 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00372 }
00373 
00374 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00375                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00376     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00377 }
00378 
00379 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00380 
00381 {
00382     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00383 
00384     adeos_load_cpuid();
00385 
00386     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00387        and always inside a critical section. */
00388     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00389     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00390     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00391     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00392 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00393     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00394 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00395 }
00396 
00397 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00398     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00399 }
00400 
00401 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00402                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00403 {
00404     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00405     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00406     unsigned long flags;
00407 
00408     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00409 
00410     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00411 
00412     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00413         {
00414         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00415         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00416 
00417         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00418 
00419         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00420 
00421         if (prev != next)
00422             {
00423             get_mmu_context(next);
00424             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00425             }
00426 
00427         if (!inproc->mm)
00428             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00429 
00430         /* The following has been lifted from
00431            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00432 
00433 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00434         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00435             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00436 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00437         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00438             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00439 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00440 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00441         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00442             giveup_spe(outproc);
00443 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00444 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00445 
00446 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00447         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00448             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00449 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00450 
00451 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00452         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00453             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00454 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00455 
00456         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00457         }
00458     else
00459         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00460         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00461 
00462     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00463 }
00464 
00465 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00466                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00467     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00468 }
00469 
00470 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00471     /* Empty */
00472 }
00473 
00474 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00475 
00476 {
00477 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00478 
00479     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00480 
00481     if (task)
00482         {
00483         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00484             giveup_fpu(task);
00485 
00486         return;
00487         }
00488 
00489     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00490 
00491     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00492 
00493 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00494 }
00495 
00496 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00497 
00498 {
00499 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00500 
00501     if (tcb->user_task)
00502         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00503            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00504            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00505         return;
00506 
00507     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00508 
00509     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00510 
00511 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00512 }
00513 
00514 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00515                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00516                                          const char *name)
00517 {
00518     tcb->user_task = current;
00519     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00520     tcb->ksp = 0;
00521     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00522 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00523     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00524 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00525     tcb->entry = NULL;
00526     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00527     tcb->self = thread;
00528     tcb->imask = 0;
00529     tcb->name = name;
00530 }
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00533 
00534     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00535     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00536     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00537 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00538     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00539 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00540     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00541 }
00542 
00543 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00544 
00545 {
00546     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00547     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00548     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00549     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00553                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00554                                        void *cookie,
00555                                        int imask,
00556                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00557                                        char *name)
00558 {
00559     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00560 
00561     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00562 
00563     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00564     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00565     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00566     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00567     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00568     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00569 
00570     tcb->entry = entry;
00571     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00572     tcb->self = thread;
00573     tcb->imask = imask;
00574     tcb->name = name;
00575 }
00576 
00577 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00578 
00579 {
00580 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00581     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00582        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00583     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00584     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00585 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00586 }
00587 
00588 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00589 
00590     while (!*flagp)
00591         {
00592         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00593         schedule_timeout(1);
00594         }
00595 }
00596 
00597 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00598 
00599 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00600 
00601     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00602 }
00603 
00604 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00605 
00606 {
00607     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00608                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00609                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00610                                      NULL,
00611                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00612 }
00613 
00614 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00615 
00616 {
00617     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00618                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00619                                      NULL,
00620                                      NULL,
00621                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00622 }
00623 
00624 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00625 
00626 {
00627     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00628     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00629 }
00630 
00631 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00632 
00633 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00634 
00635     return 0;
00636 }
00637 
00638 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00639 
00640     return 0;
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00644 
00645     return 0;
00646 }
00647 
00648 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00649 
00650 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00651 
00652 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00653 
00654 {
00655 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00656     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00657        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00658     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00659 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00660     xnshadow_release_events();
00661     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00662     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00663     schedule_timeout(50);
00664     xnarch_release_ipi();
00665 }
00666 
00667 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00668 
00669 {
00670     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00671 
00672     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00673         {
00674         spl_t s;
00675         splsync(s);
00676         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00677         splexit(s);
00678         return 1;
00679         }
00680 
00681     return 0;
00682 }
00683 
00684 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00685 
00686     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00687 }
00688 
00689 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00690 
00691     kfree(chunk);
00692 }
00693 
00694 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00695     
00696     xnshadow_grab_events();
00697 }
00698 
00699 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00700 
00701 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00702 
00703 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00704                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00705                                            const char *name)
00706 {
00707     struct task_struct *task = current;
00708 
00709     tcb->user_task = task;
00710     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00711     tcb->ksp = 0;
00712     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00713 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00714     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00715 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00716     tcb->entry = NULL;
00717     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00718     tcb->self = thread;
00719     tcb->imask = 0;
00720     tcb->name = name;
00721 }
00722 
00723 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00724 
00725 {
00726     unsigned irq;
00727 
00728     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00729         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00730                              handler,
00731                              NULL,
00732                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00733 
00734     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00735        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00736        individually. */
00737 
00738     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00739                          handler,
00740                          NULL,
00741                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00742 }
00743 
00744 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00745 
00746 {
00747     unsigned irq;
00748 
00749     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00750         {
00751         switch (irq)
00752             {
00753 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00754             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00755 
00756                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00757                 continue;
00758 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00759 
00760             default:
00761 
00762                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00763             }
00764         }
00765 
00766     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00770 
00771 {
00772     unsigned irq;
00773 
00774     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00775         {
00776         switch (irq)
00777             {
00778 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00779             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00780 
00781                 continue;
00782 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00783 
00784             default:
00785 
00786                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00787             }
00788         }
00789 
00790     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00791 }
00792 
00793 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00794 
00795 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00796 
00797 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00798     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00799        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00800        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. Since the
00801        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00802        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */ 
00803     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00804 }
00805 
00806 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00807     rthal_release_timer();
00808 }
00809 
00810 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00811 
00812 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00813 
00814 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00815 
00816 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00817 
00818 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00819 
00820 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00821 
00822 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00823 
00824 {
00825     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00826     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00827     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00828 }
00829 
00830 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00831 
00832 {
00833 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00834     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00835        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00836     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00837 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00838 
00839     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00840 
00841     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00842         return -ENOSYS;
00843 
00844     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00845                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00846                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00847                               NULL,
00848                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00849 
00850     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00851 
00852     return xnshadow_init();
00853 }
00854 
00855 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00856 
00857     xnshadow_cleanup();
00858     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00859     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00860 }
00861 
00862 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00863 
00864 #ifdef __cplusplus
00865 }
00866 #endif
